book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Best introductory book on incorporating herbs into our daily lives
review:
Wow! That was the first thing that came out of my mouth as I began reading this book. It is by far the best introductory book I have seen in my almost three decades of learning about herbal medicine and herbal support. I was hesitant to buy another introductory herb book as my knowledge is beyond the introductory level. But the recipes in this book are worth every penny.

I wish I had this book to start with back then. I think it would have saved me money, time and energy as I explored what I thought was herbal medicine content. The content is not overwhelming and if this is the only herb book you learn from you will have a basic foundation if using herbs for nutritional support and basic home remedies. The foundational content includes an explanation about how herbs serve individuals unlike our current system of One Solution Syndrome for everyone (take a pill for this and then take a pill for that), a well-explained overview of the energetics of herbs and deep dive into the tastes of herbs - which is my favorite part.

More than anything else, I love the simplicity of introducing herbs through food and cooking. Food should always be our first medicine - which is how I can easily justify a Cardamon Chocolate Mousse Cake each month since it so good for me! Another aspect I like about the recipes is that they are all very doable: no specialized equipment, no huge orders of exotic herbs and spices and no tricky culinary skills required. The author has done a remarkable job of making herbal support both legitimate to the doubtful and accessible to the open-minded.

Most importantly, Rosalee uses her clinical skills throughout her writing and offers recent research to support medicinal applications. She also employs safety and caution and gives specific examples of what some herbs can do (because yes, they really work!) to some individuals.

Overall, I think this is the best introductory book on incorporating herbs and their nutritional and medicinal properties to support our health.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Finally, a Guide for actually USING Herbs beyond just Tisanes
review: I'm not sure what I was expecting (maybe the stereotypical herb book) but Rosalee has covered SO much more than I imagined would be in there! I've only skimmed through so far but want to say I love all the photos, powerfully useful information and the easy to read tone and type font. And of course that "new book smell" Just knowing some Herbs and ID'ing them is one thing, but learning ways to actually USE them (aside from plain old tisanes, tinctures and salves) is a real treasure! This will make a great gift for my sisters who are learning about Herbs, too, and my daughter so she can prepare even healthier and more fun meals. My grandkids are excited to forage with me this season. What better way to get them excited about nature, nutrition, their meals, survival basics - and keeping their noses out of electronic devices as they get older - than hands on "doing". ? We need more practical application guides like this.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: TL;DR - 6 stars on every important point!
review:
This book is amazing!
Although, If you're looking for a "this herb heals this issue" sort of book, this isn't for you. If you want to know how to use herbs in just about any other way though, this book IS for you!

My favorite parts are (in no particular order):
1- the full color pictures of the herbs so I can take it out with me to try to identify wild plants,
2- the glossary at the back! I'm learning but not all of the vocab has stuck yet
3- the actual studies about the herbs! until Rosalee talked about it a little while ago I bought into the "herbs-aren't-studied" rumor but now I have sourced studies that I can kindly share with the mis-informed. We shall end this rumor!
4- It's not as tall as I was expecting. At first, it kind of made me sad but I realized quickly that it will fit in my diaperbag better so I can carry it with me everywhere without cutting back on diaperbag necessities.
5- There are a list of places at the back of the book that provide herbs and supplies along with info on if they provide the herbs and/ or the supplies and if there are other things you should know (one of the places provides fresh herbs but you have to order those in advance).
6- Instead of a text book or recipe book, it's feels almost like a story. It's all personalized with stories and emotion so it's like reading a letter from a friend, exactly what a great book should do.
7- While not every recipe has a picture of it, a huge majority of them do (including a couple very tempting desserts) and the ones that don't seem to be things like the teas that all look fairly similar anyways.
8- "Part 1" where she goes into the taste of herbs and the importance of energetics. I've learned these from her but I'm very happy they're in the book as both a reminder and also to make it easier for me to help and teach others.
9- They aren't all food recipes! There are other things too like "Lavender bath salts", "Cayenne salve", and "Cinnamon tooth powder"
10- The cute picture of the ladybug on the sage leaf on page 158.
11- She lists the special considerations of the herbs. Things like "use in low doses (or avoid) if pregnant", "avoid if you're on blood thinners", and other sorts of things that one needs to consider.
12- The metric conversion chart!

On the other side, there were a couple things I didn't like
1- The corner of the cover was slightly bent up when I opened the box. Most likely Amazon's fault since the box was quite a bit bigger than it needed to be and the packaging only slightly prevented the book from moving around.
2- Several of the pages were cut slightly off. They're the same size as the book but the bottom line of a couple of the "who-said-the-quote"s got sliced in half. I can still read it but there is a small strip of white at the top.

Because the first issue isn't their fault and the second one has nothing to do with the quality of information or how it is presented, I'm still going to wish I could give it more stars or something along those lines. And I'm honestly considering buying another for a wedding present for a friend and possibly a few for presents this Christmas.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Inspiring and lovely
review:
Super Love this book!!!! There are several things I am enjoying about it.
Firstly, it has gorgeous pictures! For a visual learner, this is so lovely. Secondly, there are just the right amount of practical uses & recipe suggestions for each herb. Lastly, and most importantly to me, Rosealee has a warm, wonderful, & relaxed way of relating the information to you, the reader. I fell in love with the book when I read about the herb, rosemary, & her account of her visit to southern France. She recalls hiking down a dusty trail that lead her to beautiful view of the Mediterranean, where she found at her feet a large patch of fragrant and flourishing rosemary. She was inspired by her experience in that moment, recalling that rosemary means, "dew of the sea. " Reading her personal experience with the herbs not only makes me want to learn more about the herbs themselves, but keeps me grounded, remembering that we learn about herbs as they relate to people. Its inspiring to me. It's not just about botanical science, & the alchemy of herbs. The science alone is intensely interesting to me, but the relational aspect of helping other humans is what makes learning it all truly worth it to me.
A truly love work, Rosealee. A job well done. Thank you.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: A Herb Book for Everyone using Everyday Ingredients!
review:
An herb book for everyday people using everyday ingredients!

I can't understate how much of a win-win this book is for everyone interested in becoming knowledgeable about herbs. Whether your ultimate goal is to build a pantry-size apothecary or brew a nourishing cup of tea using , this book is written for you.

Although I consider myself fairly well-versed in the herb department, I like that this book is written for people who are not...in an easy read manner with plenty of tools, such as quizzes, exercises, and recipes to help you navigate down the herbal highway:

* what types of herbs to use for your personal constitution (whether you are hot, cold, damp, or dry);
* how herbs can help "tune" up your system and keep it running smoothly; and
* how best to use those herbs (steeped in tea, blended into a lotion, added to pesto sauce, baked in a cake).

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Wonderful and Incredibly Helpful
review:
This book exceeded my expectations. I read it in 2 days because the style is simple but rich with description and I have to add, very easy to understand. I finally had to get my sticky notes to mark the pages I wanted to go back to because after the 20th page of thinking “I’d like to try this...” or “this is fascinating, I’ll come back to this page,” I lost track.

It’s packed with origin, usage, dosages, how to’s, vibrant pictures, and resources. The first chapter broke down every single question I ever had about “I wonder why “this” isn’t working for me.” I understand now that my physical balance determines what I need rather than searching for supplement to fix all. If your looking for an all around easy to read approach to begin a healthy lifestyle, this is a great book.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Accessible and powerful info
review:
My first thought was - why do I need another herb book? I've got the coffee table one that has pretty pictures, I've got the one by the lady who lives in the woods and tells the medicinal values...Well, I'll tell you why.
This book makes herbs completely accessible. It illuminates the cozy, comforting and yet powerful and continuous connection between our nourishment and our healing, between our food and our medicine.
Rosalee helps us realize that healing and supporting health doesn't have to be something that is difficult, dangerous, and done only in special places by intensely educated people. It can start at home with adding some garlic and turmeric to your soup, and dandelion greens to your salad (and hundreds of other delicious and healthy ways!)
It is an inclusive book that doesn't bash anyone, but like nourishing herbs, simply serves to bolster the good and illuminate connections.
I appreciate this addition to my kitchen AND medicine shelf.
Thank you! (I've also given several as gifts to very appreciate friends :) )

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: This is the beginning herbalists new bible!!
review:
One might expect this book to be the main textbook to Herbalism 101. I have worked with herbs for several years and many of the books out there leave one disappointed. Not Rosalee's excellent tome!! Quite honestly, this is the book I was searching for years ago, warm, informative, easy to understand and yes, even funny at times!! This is the beginning herbalists new bible. And yet, it is equally informative and useful for the experienced herbalist.
If you are just beginning your journey into the fascinating world of Herbs and healthy natural living this is the book to start with!! But don't just look for a cure. Start with the introduction and read it all. At a glance it looks rather dry, but there is a wealth of knowledge on every page!!!

review: Everything I expected and more. Even though I had previews of the photos and recipes, the final product is above and beyond what I imagined. The photos are gorgeous, the herb details are encompassing yet succinct, appropriate for a "cook book." As an herbalist and an avid foodie, this book is the perfect combo of herbal medicine and how to prepare them in food and other applications. I have been carrying it around in my purse since the day after I received it, so I can show it to my friends and fellow foodies. Everyone I show it to has quickly commented that they, "have to get this book!" A work of art and science that is a must for any foodie's cook book shelf!

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Well Organized and Informative
review: This book is very well organized for anyone new to herbology. I particularly liked her focus on the individualized approach to medicine, incorporating the many solution approach, integrating herbology with all aspects of medicine. Diagnosing the individual rather than the disease makes each remedy individualized. Our thoughts, feelings and environment may result in dis-ease and the western approach of soothing the symptoms actually makes discovering the root cause that much harder. I also liked her simple explanations, her organization of herbs into sweet, sour, bitter, salty and pungent, and the fantastic recipes which allow one to fully incorporate the herbs into one's life.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: It's not your common herbal!
review:
This is a wonderful book! It is not like a common herbal. It is not based on take this for that, one size fits all practice. It is evident Rosalee has done much research, and has used these herbs extensively. She gives history, and instructs about the energetics of the plants and matching it to the energetics of the person, all described is a easy-to-understand way. The recipes are delicious! These are amazing concoctions that are easily prepared, with common ingredients, delighting you senses. She gives several recipes for each herb discussed. Rosalee wants people to use herbs everyday in their daily life as food.

When I opened the book I could not put it down! It is written is such an interesting way, with beautiful photography. I read through quickly, and have made several of the recipes already. This is a book I will be using again and again.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: The cover is just as beautiful as pictured
review: Delivery was quick of this item. The cover is just as beautiful as pictured. Contents are what was expected and more and am enjoying making some stuff already and so overjoyed that Rosalee took food allergies & intolerances into account. My 5yr old daughter and I made the BEST carrot cake I've ever had immediately, w/out having to adjust the recipe for our grain free diet, as it already was. Gave some to my parents and t hey couldn't even tell it was grain free and LOVED it too and carrot cake is one of my father's favorites. The ONLY reason I gave this book 4 stars was NOT due to the author or the contents but rather the publisher/printer...I had this book less than 24hrs and the cover was coming off already, revealing just a slightly sticky gel strip holding it on, as it's supposed to have a lay-flat binding. I would've ordered another but looking at this, pretty sure it would have the same issue. Instead, I am taking it to Staples or Office Depot and having it spiral bound. I HIGHLY recommend the contents though and that is the real value here. Thank you for an excellent book Rosalee!

title: The pictures are great for enticing a beginner to try something
review: I have had this book for several months and am a teaching herbalist. The pictures are great for enticing a beginner to try something. The layout gives plenty of peaceful space; doesn't feel like it's rushing me, though the waste of paper is gnawing at the tree-lover in me. Strange balance of information in the herb taste categories, though. Only 1 salty herb is covered and 2 sweet ones with 16 pungent herbs. Unfortunately, pungent is the easiest to figure out on ones own since people are most familiar with cooking spices. They are more often used for acute symptoms like infection and pain. But, with the proliferation of degenerative diseases today, we need to know more about the building and recuperative herbs like found in salty and sweet tastes. Maybe in Rosalee's next book ...

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

This book is well written and accessible - Rosalee De La Foret has written a book as if speaking to a friend and offering useful information that I can apply everyday in my kitchen and from my own garden. I can't wait to gather dandelions this Spring!

It is refreshing to see how herbs can be used everyday in simple recipes instead of encapsulated or in standarized extracts. As a Naturopathic doctor, I usually use herbs in formulas along with homeopathic remedies. This is a great resource to teach me as well as my patients how to incorporate the plants around us in daily life to support health and also to heal.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

I appreciate that it is more than just how to make herbal medicine, but how to incorporate herbs into your diet to promote better health. She does not neglect the healing that herbs can provide. But she makes herbs and their medicine so easy to access and use. I have already tried four different recipes and they have all been amazing. My ten year old daughter made the chia seed pudding with spiced syrup tonight by herself. Everyone is eating more herbs since we got this book last week and my husband and I are counting down the days until the hawthorn cordial is ready to sip. The content is rich, the pictures beautiful, and it is extremely user friendly. This is one herbal book that will never get dusty.

This allows you to focus on the type of herbs you most frequently need. And she has provided a few recipes that use each herb or several herbs. book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: It is packed with easily accessible information that will appeal to everyone
review: I can't say enough about this book. It is packed with easily accessible information that will appeal to everyone. Rosalee takes the mystery out of using herbs in everyday meals in ways that are delicious, simple and healing and I learn something new with every page! I made the Peppery Borscht the day after I got the book and it was an explosion of colors and flavors... After dinner, I kept thinking that I couldn't wait to get hungry enough to eat more (by the way, it makes a lovely breakfast). I also served a young friend a bowl the next day. He raved about it and was surprised to know that it had beets in it because, according to him, he hates beets (but not now). He couldn't put the book down so I immediately ordered him his own copy (he'd just helped fix our wind storm damaged fence). Now he can't wait to incorporate those recipes at his work as a cook at a Senior care facility! I have a feeling I'll be re-ordering this book on a regular basis for friends and family.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

She has included easy recipes for both culinary and therapeutic use and included contraindications and side effects. This book is designed to be an easy reference for a quick reminder or a transition to deeper study. It will be a well thumbed, marked up reference in a place of honor taking up precious counter space in my tiny kitchen.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

I started adding more pepper to my meals knowing I was increasing the availability and absorption of vital nutrients from my foods, I put cinnamon in my tea. She has 100's of simple ways to maintain and increase health. Way to to go Rosalee, when is the next book?

I was completely surprised to see such details, beautiful pictures, recipes…and for the price I paid, this book is unbelievably great! I highly recommend this whether you are just beginning with herbs or seasoned in knowledge. A must for any bookshelf.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Life changing reference book

title: A great recipe book on "how to nourish and heal the body with medicinal herbs" and much more...
review:
I am always exited to buy new books on herbal medicines. Learning medical herbs is about getting to know how to use plants to best serve one's goals, whether it is to nourish or to tonify ones body. I have a lot of respect for authors who are able to provide clear and simple guidances to assist in a learning process, and bring enthusiasm and passion into that learning. I believe Rosalee De La Forêt is meant to be that enthusiastic and passionate teacher.
Alchemy of Herbs is not a compilation of symptoms relieving remedies. It is a wise selection of herbs (that might have been challenging to do), with practical advises and relevant recipes that help the reader to incorporate each of those herbs into one's daily use for one's health and wellbeing.
Rosalee De La Forêt starts with a brief explanation on energetics and how to match an herb with a person, to find out what herb is the most appropriate for one's condition. Then she develops a chapter for each of the 28 herbs she selected, regrouped according to their taste. She describes in each chapter the property of the herb, how to use it and then she goes on offering great, easy to follow recipes for each.
For the novice that I am or even the expert in herbal medicine, this book helps bring together medicinal plants and people in the most relevant setting: our kitchen!
Some will always notice that only 28 herbs are fully covered, so i see here an opportunity to call for a second, a third...or a fourth volume. 28 at a time, makes it easier to learn than an overwhelming 112. Some will complain that they did not find in here the remedy for their particular health issues, and they will miss the point of people and plants energetics.
This book will acquaint the reader with medical herbs and will give them great ideas on how to use them, like it did to me.

title: Great starter book!
review:
Even though I am experienced in using herbs in food and as medicine, I bought this book to see how it could be helpful to the beginner.

The lay out is easy to follow, is well thought out written, and the full color photographs of the herbs and preparations are excellent. Rosalee teaches you to listen to your body and match herbs to you rather than only the ailment. She covers the basics of material medica, typical uses, food and drinks recipes as well as remedies, and considerations for interactions and contraindications.

Included is a metric conversion table, glossary, recommended resources list, endnotes listed by herb chapter that include sources and studies, and of course an index.

Rosalee has created a great 'starter' book for the beginner but it can also have a space on the more experienced herbalist's shelf as well. It is a very handy resource. I'm am thrilled to have a copy of this good looking and well written book!

Rosalee is a wonderful, wise herbalist and an excellent teacher. This book will forever have an honored place among my herbals and in my kitchen. title: FINALLY, A LIVE HERBS BOOK!!!
review: There are two things I love about "Alchemy of Herbs": the book and the concept. The first, because it IS a rather heavy book (in weight and in knowledge), very well structured, very easy to read and search from, with lovely pictures. The last, because it goes way beyond the usual clinical recipes usually presented, including beauty, relax, food and drink, even spirituality. I think it is a very good way to present the materia medica, avoiding the usual role of such works (staying in the bookcase and being read only when something goes wrong) and causing the herbs to invade our lives de facto - which is what the authoress wants, of course. Kudos for her.

Whoever thought of using ginger and nutmeg as more than just a sprinkle in Egg Nog or warm milk? She explains the benefits of many everyday ingredients, and then gives you recipes to go along with it. I am a Naturopath and have read MANY cookbooks and lay manuals that do not do as good a job as Rosalee does in explaining planetary benefits, and how to use them responsibly. I love that we get recipes each time we learn how about a new herb or combination of herbs. Life is good!

BTW: There is a video companion that is totally out of this world. Go to authors site and find out more about it. If you want to learn more about herbs for health in everyday meals, start with this book and the video companion.

Information is accessable yet profound in content, presented as if she were speaking to me accross her kitchen table. Yet she is able to convey the complexities of the information so the benefits are readily available to me like never before...simply amazing. What a perfect start to my herbal journey, thank you Rosealee AND the many minions involved !

title: This Book is a MUST for Both Beginning and Established Herbalists.
review: Rosalee de la Foret is an excellent teacher, and takes the time to explain everything. This book is beautifully written, and has so many tips. I am just starting my foray into herbal medicine, and I have found that Rosalee's approach to teaching is one of the best that I've seen. One of the bonuses with getting the book was access to several videos. Her 10 Herbs to Radically Change your Health video is outstanding, and again, I was impressed by how she presents her material: very straightforward, easy to understand, yet covering all the necessary aspects. One of the things I really like is the reference section in the back of the book. The Endnotes section lists scientific research studies for each herb. This is invaluable for folks (like me) who want to research the science behind the claims for the herb, and this book doesn't disappoint. Alchemy of Herbs is a must for anyone beginning their herbal studies, as well as for those who are well established in the field.

Rosalee has managed to keep sometimes complicated information easy to read and understand, without dumbing it down. And the uses and recipies just invite you to jump in and try things. Love Indian food? The "Tumeric and Pumpkin Seed Pate' " with some pita chips or veggies, out of this world! Love coffee? Find out why that cup in the morning is so good! There's so much to explore here, just pick a favorite, or something you've never heard of or tasted before and dive in!

title: This is a nice book. I had more experience so this book ...
review:
This is a nice book. I had more experience so this book was ok for me. This book is more for someone who is just beginning a interest in herbs
and how they can be used. The basics in this book are black pepper, cayenne, cinnamon, fennel, garlic, holy basil, lavender mustard, nutmeg, parsley, peppermint, rosemary, sage, thyme, turmeric, nettle, elder, hawthorn, lemon balm, rose, artichoke, cacao, chamomile, coffee, dandelion, ashwagandha, and astragalus. Short paragraphs, great pictures but more info would have been nice. Not bad for the price but most of these things are all internet base so the author really just picked out a list and decided what she wanted to say in short paragraphs.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Nothing close to what I'd expected from a well known name in the herbalist world.
review: There was a lot of hype online leading up to this book's release, and sadly I bought into it. The book is pretty, with lots of full color photos that are very well done. But there really aren't all that many different herbs included, and the information about each one is quite limited for a book of this size. It would be really wonderful if Rosalee focused more on content and less on tons of photos and massive marketing ploys. I don't buy books because they are pretty; I buy them for the information they contain. Yes, it's nice having lots of photos, etc., but it surely doesn't make up for such limited content. Nothing close to what I'd expected from a well known name in the herbalist world.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Not enough herbs
review: The book only covers about 30 herbs but does have some nice recipes. I was hoping for a more comprehensive amount and not the typical types. Too much narrative and not enough substance. Nice pictures.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: Practical but not the whole story.
review: This book is a good introduction to cooking with herbs and spices. The pictures are very nice and it's organized like a cookbook. The writing is very personal and blogger style. The title is a bit misleading to those who want a lot more detail on the plant itself and its history. I may resent the adaptation of herbalism and spirituality into "modern western" medicine, but this book is practical and I can't take points for that. Hopefully it will reach the masses who aren't hip to ways of the graves on which we stand. I liked the sections on garlic and ginger, they were thoughtfully written and shows a good amount of research was made accessible to readers. The part about matching the herb to the person and the herbal sweet spot is a good topic to include, very important, however it's a topic subject to a lot of debate so it could have used a bit more air time. All said and done, I learned from this book. I think it appeals more to someone looking for treatment, which is a perfect reason to hold onto it. This book may not be for everyone but it's for a lot of people.

book_title: Alchemy of Herbs: Transform Everyday Ingredients into Foods and Remedies That Heal
title: The book is ok. I was expecting more.
review: The book is ok, I think I was expecting more recipes and ideas to make it easier to add to everyday meals. I can find everything in this book in other books. But if I were to suggest books for new herbalists, I would suggest anything by Rosemary Gladstar. Her books are easy to understand and lots of recipes and methods to get started even if you are new or not, to herbalism.
